alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 8:52PM CDT until April 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JO DAVIESS...NORTHWESTERN CARROLL...SOUTHWESTERN STEPHENSON...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON AND NORTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 851 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Miles, or 13 miles north of Clinton, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Teeds Grove and Camp Miss-Elk-Ton around 855 PM CDT. Sabula, Green Island, Reeceville and South Sabula Lake Park around 900 PM CDT. Savanna and Mississippi Palisades State Park around 905 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Camp Far Horizons, Massbach, Elmoville, Stockton Airport and Willow. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
